metadata.dc:author: Martínez, M J
López Pereira, P
Muguerza, R
Jaureguizar, E
metadata.dc:description: Intravesical oxybutynin chloride was administered to 12 children with neurogenic bladder and incontinence who had unacceptable side effects. Urodynamic studies showed hyperreflexia was eliminated or improvement in 100% of them and low compliance was improved (88%), with a mean increase in bladder volume to 123% and a mean decrease of filling pressure to 24 cm H2O. Six patients became completely dry (50%), 4 continent period was increased and 2 did not improve. No systemic effects were observed.
metadata.dc:title: Tratamiento tópico con cloruro de oxibutinina en la incontinencia de causa neurógena.
[Topical treatment with oxybutynin chloride in neurogenic incontinence].
metadata.dc:publisher: Cirugia pediatrica : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Cirugia Pediatrica
